There is also a extreme lack of skill points and most of the "beast skills" are pretty useless and really only apply to killing normal infected, as the skills used on bosses do less damage then using your weapons. 

Some pros are that the game looks really good and the weapons themselves are cool.

If we could we would refund if it was still possible.

Overrated and a downgrade compared to previous games.

Pros:
- It's still a Dying Light game, if you liked the previous games you'll be OK with this one.

Neutral:
- Story.  Mid, I've seen worse.
- Side quests / activities.  Most are just busy work but I wouldn't complain.

Cons:
- No fast travel.  Wasting a half of my time to traverse the map isn't a gameplay, just artificial padding that doesn't value player's time.
- Zombie models are very limited, it's the same 6-7 clones everywhere.
- They made the nights practically unplayable in this sequel, there are volatiles everywhere.  The only logical thing to do is sleep.
- Resources are too scarce, you have to loot every corpse and do Dark Zones on a regular basis to keep up.  I don't remember such issue in previous games.
- Parkour is underwhelming, I remember it being better in old games.
- Car driving and related mechanics also suck.
- No ray tracing at time of writing this despite the promises (a month and a half after release).
- No New Game+ at time of writing this despite the promises (a month and a half after release).
- HDR sucks, it's overblown and loses details compared to SDR.  I had to use RenoDX mod to tone down the overblown mess.

Most of the time it feels like a chore, not fun and I'm not sure I'm going to finish it.

If you still want to buy it, wait a few months until they add RT and NG+ and buy it on sale.

This game is alright, but there are major issues with the gameplay.
1)The stealth system is broken. Why do I get spotted in the dark by random person that's far away? It makes no sense at all, and it not only breaks immersion but it's infuriating because it alerts the enemies in the entire area that close in on you in seconds.
2)The combat is still shit, like DL2's. What made Techland think the DL2 combat system was ever good and decide to implement it into The Beast? DL1 had a much better combat system, with hits still landing even when the enemy dodges because they don't properly dodge, unlike DL2 and The Beast where I have to swing like a maniac to get a few good hits in, but they keep dodging and wasting my stamina and my weapon is dogshit so it won't hurt them.
3) The skill tree is also bad, why is it so basic and not unique? Why can't I level up my one-handed or two-handed skills? Oh ya, that's because they don't exist and it doesn't matter which weapon you use because it doesn't matter, you can't main any weapon type because all that matters is the rarity of it and that makes using weapons feel like a hassle, because if I use a rare or lesser weapon, I can't kill enemies fast enough, I shouldn't have to look for epic weapons to be able to play the game properly.

There's a lot more issues, that I'm not surprised Techland never saw, because they don't test the game properly or have any actual consumer feedback.

This was a good course correction after laughable Dying Light 2 story. But when it comes to the gameplay, at least 1/3 of the game I was [u]wasting[/u] on traversing from one corner of the map to another between missions. There are no small outposts with merchants on the level so if you want to stock up on resources you have to run or drive from 1 corner to another.

The map is a huge downgrade from DL1. The only major city has tall buildings which is not as fun to navigate as the 1 story Haran favellas. A good third of the map is an open field than you have to run through or drive if you are lucky to have a car nearby. The map is much smaller than DL1.

Far less zombies than in DL1 and there are far fewer agressive runner zombies. The campaign is ok. Cringey James Bond-style villain and a few cool moments that set you the player on the road of revenge. But it felt like an extended tutorial that tries to slowly sell mechanics over each mission, rather than a story than integrates you into the world of the game. I don't remember DL1 campaign to be that tacked on. Oh and it's quite short too.

Overall, it's just ok. Not bad but not a breakthrough either. Get it on sale if you crave more Dying Light 1 experience.

I really love the Dying Light Franchise, but this game just doesn't feel as good as DL1 or DL2. 

Pros:
-Gore is maxed. you can literally split a head open and see the brain.
-Beast mechanic is interesting as a new concept
-Voice lines are very imersive

Misc: 
-Driving cars, which I think is new, but honestly isnt super enjoyable. Only benefit is not having to run across open spaces, but rooftops are still best.

Cons:
-Night is un-playable. The darkness is turned up to 12, so you cannot see anything at all without your light. Volatiles are literally everywhere and if you get more than 1-2 you cannot kill them before you die.
-Parkour does not feel as smooth as DL2 (imo) and things that look grabable sometimes arent. Also the combat roll before hitting the ground works about 1/3rd of the time. Especially if you end up falling close to a wall.
-Quests are far and few. I have gotten about 6 quests in the 7hrs of playtime. Not to mention the area levels which place barriers to how you can get around. 
-Hitting enemies is rough. If they get too close, you lose the animation and get grappled or hit. If you try to hit them from further back, they either dodge or it misses. 

TL:DR 
I really wanted to enjoy this game, but it just doesn't feel as good as DL2. Buy it on sale and try it out, but if you have DL2, I would play that instead.

The game in general is not finished.  Co-Op has a lot of bugs, me and my friend constantly have to reset the lobbies. The day night cycle is broken.  The climbing is slow, although it gets slightly better over time. But the biggest kick in the nuts is the grapple hook is COMPLETELY USELESS.  Might as well have left the grapple hook out of the game entirely.  When running and sometimes when in battle, basic zombies initiate the annoying grab animation WAY TO OFTEN.  A little is fine but if you ever get in a chase, you'll understand.

The melee weapons are severely underwhelming.  I was hoping they'd get better over time but it seems the enemies just scale with your level and therefore you have to go through the entire game using an entire stamina bar just to kill a basic zombie.  The boss fights are just a tedious battle of wack the boss until there dead with whatever melee weapon you have.  Guns and throwables do next to 0 damage on any boss.  

The story in itself isn't necessarily bad, but it isn't anything that keeps my attention, making me want to play more to find out what happens.  At this point I've turned the game to the easiest difficulty just to clear the story and never pick up again.

Holding this game up to the standard of the older Dying Light games, everything feels twice as clunky.
Combat feels slow, unsatisfying and shackled to a stamina bar that drains incredibly fast.
Movement, especially activating 'sprint' which ties to a lot of abilities is really finicky and not intitutive at all on PC.
Looting is a chore and incredibly slow

There is a reduction in perk bloat, but I feel like this is more of a detriment than a positive, because of how clunky the system feels. There's no perks that make your stamina last longer, there's no perks that allows faster looting.

The story reminds lacks a lot in terms of motivation; it feels like I'm playing Wolfenstein set in Dying Light, except there isn't much focus on guns, but an unsatisfying melee and resource management.

Why, on god, in 2025, is FOV not up to at least 90? It feels like I'm being tunnelvisioned and I despise it.

I cannot recommend it for 60 euro.
